identity_layer.definition: Free, permanent infrastructure representing who a crew member is.

cv_import.definition: LLM-based extraction of profile data from uploaded CV files.
cv_import.purpose: Reduce onboarding friction by auto-populating profile from existing CV
cv_import.note: Not verification — extracted data is still self-reported. User must review and confirm.

presentation_layer.definition: Paid, cosmetic layer controlling how identity is presented.

canonical_monetisation_rule.definition: You can't pay to be more trusted. You can only pay to present yourself better.

yacht_graph.definition: A permanent entity graph linking crew via shared employment on yachts.
yacht_graph.purpose: Provides the verification substrate for endorsement gating and future trust signals

yacht_entity.definition: A database record representing a yacht, identified by immutable internal UUID.
yacht_entity.note: Human-readable names are display labels, not identity. Duplicates are tolerated in Phase 1.

attachment.definition: A crew member's claimed employment relationship with a yacht entity.
attachment.verification: Self-reported in Phase 1. Gating mechanism for endorsements.

colleague_coworker.definition: A person you worked with on the same yacht or within the same company during an overlapping time period. Colleague relationships are graph edges created via verified employment overlap and represent the strongest form of professional relationship on Yachtielink.

irl_connection.definition: A person you have met in real life and verified through an in-person interaction using the Yachtielink app. IRL connections are graph edges that confirm real-world contact but do not imply a working relationship.

contact.definition: A messaging-only relationship that allows professional communication without creating a graph edge. Contacts do not affect trust, endorsements, or graph structure and exist to support coordination and future real-world interaction.

graph_edge.definition: A relationship that contributes to the Yachtielink graph. Only Colleague and IRL Connection relationships create graph edges.

network.definition: The set of people who can see a user's timeline posts. A user's network includes Colleagues, IRL Connections, and Contacts. Only Colleagues and IRL Connections contribute to the graph.

interaction.definition: A verified in-person encounter between two or more users. Interactions create IRL Connections between participants and may be public or private.

right_of_exit.definition: The ability for any user to remove themselves from an interaction or tagged post at any time, instantly removing their association from all other viewers.

timeline.definition: A chronological profile stream containing posts, interactions, and milestones shared within a user's network.

post.definition: A user-authored timeline entry containing text and optional photos, visible based on network visibility rules.

milestone.definition: A timeline entry derived from major certifications or career changes (joining or leaving a yacht or company).

endorsement.definition: A positive, contextual signal from one crew member about another.
endorsement.structure: Free-text plus structured metadata (role, yacht, dates)

retraction.definition: The removal or deletion of a previously given endorsement.
retraction.backend_effect: Affects endorser's future signal weight; feeds into Phase 2 trust calculations

peer_hiring.definition: Job posting and application system where crew hire crew.
peer_hiring.key_feature: Graph visibility — both parties see mutual colleagues/IRL connections, shared yachts, endorsement paths
peer_hiring.rationale: Hiring incentives align when both parties are nodes in the trust graph with visible reputations

signal.definition: Any data point that contributes to a user's trust profile.

signal_weight.definition: The relative strength or influence of a signal in trust calculations.

trust_outcome.definition: Any system-derived signal affecting credibility or safety assessment.

tripwire.definition: A metric threshold that triggers a predefined action when crossed.
tripwire.purpose: Early warning system to protect trust before damage compounds

growth_pause.definition: Switching from public signup to invite-only mode.

crew_pro.definition: The paid subscription tier for crew members.

availability_toggle.definition: Crew opt-in to being discoverable via search.
availability_toggle.purpose: Active opt-in protects crew from unwanted contact. Weekly expiry prevents stale profiles.

recruiter_account.definition: Separate account type for recruitment agencies to access crew search.

recruiter_subscription.definition: Monthly fee for recruiter dashboard access.

credits.definition: Recruiter currency for unlocking crew profiles from search results.
credits.persistence: Unlock is permanent per recruiter-crew pair

profile_unlock.definition: Recruiter action to reveal name and contact details from search results.
profile_unlock.permanent: Once unlocked, always accessible to that recruiter

contextual_visibility.definition: Profile visibility varies based on how it's accessed.
contextual_visibility.graph_browsing: Full profile visible to logged-in users
contextual_visibility.search_results: Locked for recruiters (credit to unlock), full for Pro crew

phase_1.goal: Ship free identity infrastructure, paid presentation upgrades, and recruiter access monetisation
phase_1.completion: Cash-flow neutral, organic sharing, endorsement density thresholds met

phase_2.goal: Introduce validated trust signals and protection mechanisms

phase_3.goal: Aggregate signals into higher-order insights without exposing individuals

constitutional_decision.definition: A decision that is irreversible and foundational to system integrity.

architectural_decision.definition: A decision about system structure that is hard to reverse but not impossible.

operational_decision.definition: A decision about execution that can be adjusted based on learning.

shadow_constrain.definition: Rate-limiting or restricting a user's capabilities without notification.
shadow_constrain.purpose: Slow potential abuse while gathering evidence, without public accusation

freeze.definition: Suspending a user's endorsement activity pending investigation.
freeze.trigger: Three or more independent reports, or concrete evidence of abuse
